description: USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference, Release 28

fields.name: NDB_No
fields.description: 5-digit Nutrient Databank number that uniquely identifies a food item. If this field is defined as numeric, the leading zero will be lost.

fields.name: FdGrp_Cd
fields.description: 4-digit code indicating food group to which a food item belongs.

fields.name: Long_Desc
fields.description: 200-character description of food item.

fields.name: Shrt_Desc
fields.description: 60-character abbreviated description of food item. Generated from the 200-character description using abbreviations in Appendix A. If short description is longer than 60 characters, additional abbreviations are made.

fields.name: ComName
fields.description: Other names commonly used to describe a food, including local or regional names for various foods, for example, "soda" or "pop" for "carbonated beverages."

fields.name: ManufacName
fields.description: Indicates the company that manufactured the product, when appropriate.

fields.name: Survey
fields.description: Indicates if the food item is used in the USDA Food and Nutrient Database for Dietary Studies (FNDDS) and thus has a complete nutrient profile for the 65 FNDDS nutrients.

fields.name: Ref_desc
fields.description: Description of inedible parts of a food item (refuse), such as seeds or bone.

fields.name: Refuse
fields.description: Percentage of refuse.

fields.name: SciName
fields.description: Scientific name of the food item. Given for the least processed form of the food (usually raw), if applicable.

fields.name: N_Factor
fields.description: Factor for converting nitrogen to protein (see p. 12).

fields.name: Pro_Factor
fields.description: Factor for calculating calories from protein (see p. 14).

fields.name: Fat_Factor
fields.description: Factor for calculating calories from fat (see p. 14).

fields.name: CHO_Factor
fields.description: Factor for calculating calories from carbohydrate (see p. 14).

fields.name: NDB_No
fields.description: 5-digit Nutrient Databank number that uniquely identifies a food item. If this field is defined as numeric, the leading zero will be lost.

fields.name: Nutr_No
fields.description: Unique 3-digit identifier code for a nutrient.

fields.name: Nutr_Val
fields.description: Amount in 100 grams, edible portion (Nutrient values have been rounded to a specified number of decimal places for each nutrient. Number of decimal places is listed in the Nutrient Definition file.).

fields.name: Num_Data_Pts
fields.description: Number of data points is the number of analyses used to calculate the nutrient value. If the number of data points is 0, the value was calculated or imputed.

fields.name: Std_Error
fields.description: Standard error of the mean. Null if cannot be calculated. The standard error is also not given if the number of data points is less than three.

fields.name: Src_Cd
fields.description: Code indicating type of data.

fields.name: Deriv_Cd
fields.description: Data Derivation Code giving specific information on how the value is determined. This field is populated only for items added or updated starting with SR14. This field may not be populated if older records were used in the calculation of the mean value.

fields.name: Ref_NDB_No
fields.description: NDB number of the item used to calculate a missing value. Populated only for items added or updated starting with SR14.

fields.name: Add_Nutr_Mark
fields.description: Indicates a vitamin or mineral added for fortification or enrichment. This field is populated for ready-to-eat breakfast cereals and many brand-name hot cereals in food group 08.

fields.name: Num_Studies
fields.description: Number of studies.

fields.name: Min
fields.description: Minimum value.

fields.name: Max
fields.description: Maximum value.

fields.name: DF
fields.description: Degrees of freedom.

fields.name: Low_EB
fields.description: Lower 95% error bound.

fields.name: Up_EB
fields.description: Upper 95% error bound.

fields.name: Stat_cmt
fields.description: Statistical comments. See definitions below.

fields.name: AddMod_Date
fields.description: Indicates when a value was either added to the database or last modified.

fields.name: CC
fields.description: Confidence Code indicating data quality, based on evaluation of sample plan, sample handling, analytical method, analytical quality control, and number of samples analyzed. Not included in this release, but is planned for future releases.

fields.name: NDB_No
fields.description: 5-digit Nutrient Databank number that uniquely identifies a food item. If this field is defined as numeric, the leading zero will be lost.

fields.name: Seq
fields.description: Sequence number.

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: Unit modifier (for example, 1 in "1 cup").

fields.name: Msre_Desc
fields.description: Description (for example, cup, diced, and 1-inch pieces).

fields.name: Gm_Wgt
fields.description: Gram weight.

fields.name: Num_Data_Pts
fields.description: Number of data points.

fields.name: Std_Dev
fields.description: Standard deviation.

fields.name: NDB_No
fields.description: 5-digit Nutrient Databank number that uniquely identifies a food item. If this field is defined as numeric, the leading zero will be lost.

fields.name: Footnt_No
fields.description: Sequence number. If a given footnote applies to more than one nutrient number, the same footnote number is used. As a result, this file cannot be indexed and there is no primary key.

fields.name: Footnt_Typ
fields.description: Type of footnote: D = footnote adding information to the food description; M = footnote adding information to measure description; N = footnote providing additional information on a nutrient value. If the Footnt_typ = N, the Nutr_No will also be filled in.

fields.name: Nutr_No
fields.description: Unique 3-digit identifier code for a nutrient to which footnote applies.

fields.name: Footnt_Txt
fields.description: Footnote text.

fields.name: FdGrp_Cd
fields.description: 4-digit code identifying a food group. Only the first 2 digits are currently assigned. In the future, the last 2 digits may be used. Codes may not be consecutive.

fields.name: FdGrp_Desc
fields.description: Name of food group.

fields.name: NDB_No
fields.description: 5-digit Nutrient Databank number that uniquely identifies a food item. If this field is defined as numeric, the leading zero will be lost.

fields.name: Factor_Code
fields.description: The LanguaL factor from the Thesaurus.

fields.name: Factor_Code
fields.description: The LanguaL factor from the Thesaurus. Only those codes used to factor the foods contained in the LanguaL Factor file are included in this file.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of the LanguaL Factor Code from the thesaurus.

fields.name: Nutr_No
fields.description: Unique 3-digit identifier code for a nutrient.

fields.name: Units
fields.description: Units of measure (mg, g, mcg, and so on).

fields.name: Tagname
fields.description: International Network of Food Data Systems (INFOODS) Tagnames. (INFOODS, 2014.) A unique abbreviation for a nutrient/food component developed by INFOODS to aid in the interchange of data.

fields.name: NutrDesc
fields.description: Name of nutrient/food component.

fields.name: Num_Dec
fields.description: Number of decimal places to which a nutrient value is rounded.

fields.name: SR_Order
fields.description: Used to sort nutrient records in the same order as various reports produced from SR.

fields.name: Src_Cd
fields.description: 2-digit code indicating type of data.

fields.name: SrcCd_Desc
fields.description: Description of source code that identifies the type of nutrient data.

fields.name: Deriv_Cd
fields.description: Derivation Code.

fields.name: Deriv_Desc
fields.description: Description of derivation code giving specific information on how the value was determined.

fields.name: DataSrc_ID
fields.description: Unique ID identifying the reference/source.

fields.name: Authors
fields.description: List of authors for a journal article or name of sponsoring organization for other documents.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title of article or name of document, such as a report from a company or trade association.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: Year article or document was published.

fields.name: Journal
fields.description: Name of the journal in which the article was published.

fields.name: Vol_City
fields.description: Volume number for journal articles, books, or reports; city where sponsoring organization is located.

fields.name: Issue_State
fields.description: Issue number for journal article; State where the sponsoring organization is located.

fields.name: Start_Page
fields.description: Starting page number of article/document.

fields.name: End_Page
fields.description: Ending page number of article/document.

fields.name: NDB_No
fields.description: 5-digit Nutrient Databank number that uniquely identifies a food item. If this field is defined as numeric, the leading zero will be lost.

fields.name: Nutr_No
fields.description: Unique 3-digit identifier code for a nutrient.

fields.name: DataSrc_ID
fields.description: Unique ID identifying the reference/source.
